item.title: Joanna add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Joanna add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Always there comes an hour when one is weary of one's work and devotion to duty, and all one craves for is a loved face, the warmth and wonder of a loving heart." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The evil that is in the world almost always comes from ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "...the habit of despair is worse than despair itself." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "And he knew, also, what the old man was thinking as his tears flowed, and he, Rieux, thought it too: that a loveless world is a dead world, and always there comes an hour when one is weary of prisons, of one's work, and of devotion to duty, and all one craves for is a loved face, the warmth and wonder of a loving heart." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "What if the worst is true? What if there's no God, and you only go around once, and that's it? Don't you want to be a part of the experience? You know, what the hell? It's not all a drag, and I'm thinking to myself: Geez! I should stop ruining my life searching for answers I'm never gonna get and just enjoy it while it lasts. And, you know, after--who knows? Maybe there is something, nobody really knows. I know that maybe is a very slim reed to hang your whole life on, but that's the best we have." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Johnny Cash
item.description: "There's unconditional love there. You hear that phrase a lot but it's real with me and her [June Carter]. She loves me in spite of everything, in spite of myself. She has saved my life more than once. She's always been there with her love, and it has certainly made me forget the pain for a long time, many times. When it gets dark and everybody's gone home and the lights are turned off, it's just me and her." -- Johnny Cash

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Ever morning, until you dead in the ground, you gone have to make this decision. You gone have to ask yourself, "Am I gone believe what them fools say about me today?" -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Caleb Carr
item.description: "It is the greatest truth of our age: Information is not knowledge." -- Caleb Carr

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "Why did everything always change when all you wanted, all you had ever humbly asked of whatever God there might be, was that certain things be allowed to stay the same?" -- Richard Yates

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "Are artists and writers the only people entitled to lives of their own?" -- Richard Yates

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "And do you know a funny thing? I'm almost fifty years old and I've never understood anything in my whole life." -- Richard Yates

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "If my work has a theme, I suspect it is a simple one: that most human beings are inescapably alone, and therein lies their tragedy." -- Richard Yates

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Gracie Allen
item.description: "When I was born I was so surprised I didn't talk for a year and a half." -- Gracie Allen

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Irene Nemirovsky
item.description: "Important events — whether serious, happy or unfortunate — do not change a man's soul, they merely bring it into relief, just as a strong gust of wind reveals the true shape of a tree when it blows off all its leaves. Such events highlight what is hidden in the shadows, they nudge the spirit towards a place where it can flourish." -- Irene Nemirovsky

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Helen Fielding
item.description: "It struck me as pretty ridiculous to be called Mr. Darcy and to stand on your own looking snooty at a party. It's like being called Heathcliff and insisting on spending the entire evening in the garden, shouting "Cathy" and banging your head against a tree." -- Helen Fielding
